alert.note: Alert for Hocking; Pickaway; Pike; Ross; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 07 at 4:12AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SOUTHWESTERN HOCKING, SOUTHEASTERN PICKAWAY, EASTERN PIKE, EASTERN SCIOTO AND ROSS COUNTIES THROUGH 445 AM EDT... At 412 AM EDT, strong thunderstorms were located from 7 miles south of New Holland to 7 miles northeast of Waverly to Load, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Chillicothe, Portsmouth, Circleville, Wheelersburg, Waverly, New Boston, Kingston, South Webster, Rosemount, Clarktown, Franklin Furnace, Logan Elm Village, Hocking Hills State Park, Sciotodale, North Folk Village, Lucasville, Frankfort, Londonderry, Stoutsville and Laurelville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
